summary.para: A JSONTokener takes a source string and extracts characters and tokens from it. It is used by the JSONObject and JSONArray constructors to parse JSON source strings.
Ported to C# by Are Bjolseth, teleplan.no

member.name: F:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.myIndex
member.summary: The index of the next character.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Construct a JSONTokener from a string.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.back
member.summary: Back up one character. This provides a sort of lookahead capability, so that you can test for a digit or letter before attempting to parse the next number or identifier.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.dehexchar(System.Char)
member.summary: Get the hex value of a character (base16).
member.param: A character between '0' and '9' or between 'A' and 'F' or between 'a' and 'f'.
member.returns: An int between 0 and 15, or -1 if c was not a hex digit.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.more
member.summary: Determine if the source string still contains characters that next() can consume.
member.returns: true if not yet at the end of the source.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.next
member.summary: Get the next character in the source string.
member.returns: The next character, or 0 if past the end of the source string.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.next(System.Char)
member.summary: Consume the next character, and check that it matches a specified character

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.next(System.Int32)
member.param: The number of characters to take.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.nextClean
member.summary: Get the next char in the string, skipping whitespace and comments (slashslash and slashstar).
member.returns: A character, or 0 if there are no more characters.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.nextString(System.Char)
member.summary: Return the characters up to the next close quote character. Backslash processing is done. The formal JSON format does not allow strings in single quotes, but an implementation is allowed to accept them.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.nextTo(System.Char)
member.summary: Get the text up but not including the specified character or the end of line, whichever comes first.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.nextTo(System.String)
member.summary: Get the text up but not including one of the specified delimeter characters or the end of line, which ever comes first.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.nextObject
member.summary: Get the next value as object. The value can be a Boolean, Double, Integer, JSONArray, JSONObject, or String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.skipTo(System.Char)
member.summary: Skip characters until the next character is the requested character. If the requested character is not found, no characters are skipped.
member.returns: The requested character, or zero if the requested character is not found.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.skipPast(System.String)
member.summary: Skip characters until past the requested string. If it is not found, we are left at the end of the source.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.ToString
member.summary: Make a printable string of this JSONTokener.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.unescape
member.summary: Unescape the source text. Convert %hh sequences to single characters, and convert plus to space. There are Web transport systems that insist on doing unnecessary URL encoding. This provides a way to undo it.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener.unescape(System.String)
member.summary: Convert %hh sequences to single characters, and convert plus to space.
member.param: A string that may contain plus and %hh sequences.

member.name: T:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONUtils
M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONUtils.Enquote(System.String)
member.summary: Produce a string in double quotes with backslash sequences in all the right places.
member.returns: A String correctly formatted for insertion in a JSON message.

member.name: T:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject
member.summary:
A JSONArray is an ordered sequence of values. Its external form is a string wrapped in square brackets with commas between the values. The internal form is an object having get() and opt() methods for accessing the values by index, and put() methods for adding or replacing values. The values can be any of these types: Boolean, JSONArray, JSONObject, Number, String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.
The constructor can convert a JSON external form string into an internal form Java object. The toString() method creates an external form string.
A get() method returns a value if one can be found, and throws an exception if one cannot be found. An opt() method returns a default value instead of throwing an exception, and so is useful for obtaining optional values.
The generic get() and opt() methods return an object which you can cast or query for type. There are also typed get() and opt() methods that do typing checking and type coersion for you.
The texts produced by the toString() methods are very strict. The constructors are more forgiving in the texts they will accept.
An extra comma may appear just before the closing bracket.
Strings may be quoted with single quotes.
Strings do not need to be quoted at all if they do not contain leading or trailing spaces, and if they do not contain any of these characters: { } [ ] / \ : ,
Numbers may have the 0- (octal) or 0x- (hex) prefix.
Public Domain 2002 JSON.org @author JSON.org @version 0.1
Ported to C# by Are Bjolseth, teleplan.no TODO: 1. Implement Custom exceptions 2. Add indexer JSONObject[i] = object, and object = JSONObject[i]; 3. Add indexer JSONObject["key"] = object, and object = JSONObject["key"] 4. Add unit testing 5. Add log4net 6. Make get/put methods private, to force use of indexer instead?

member.name: F:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.myHashMap
member.summary: The hash map where the JSONObject's properties are kept.

member.name: F:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.myKeyIndexList
member.summary: A shadow list of keys to enable access by sequence of insertion

member.name: F:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.NULL
member.summary: It is sometimes more convenient and less ambiguous to have a NULL object than to use C#'s null value. JSONObject.NULL.toString() returns "null".

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.#ctor(NBear.Common.JSON.JSONTokener)
member.summary: Construct a JSONObject from a JSONTokener.
member.param: A JSONTokener object containing the source string.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Construct a JSONObject from a string.
member.param: A string beginning with '{' and ending with '}'.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.#ctor(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Construct a JSONObject from a IDictionary

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.accumulate(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Accumulate values under a key. It is similar to the put method except that if there is already an object stored under the key then a JSONArray is stored under the key to hold all of the accumulated values. If there is already a JSONArray, then the new value is appended to it. In contrast, the put method replaces the previous value.
member.param: An object to be accumulated under the key.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.getValue(System.String)
member.summary: Alias to Java get method Get the value object associated with a key.
member.returns: The object associated with the key.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.getJSONArray(System.String)
member.summary: Get the JSONArray value associated with a key.
member.returns: A JSONArray which is the value

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.getJSONObject(System.String)
member.summary: Get the JSONObject value associated with a key.
member.returns: A JSONObject which is the value.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.getString(System.String)
member.summary: Get the string associated with a key.
member.returns: A string which is the value.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.has(System.String)
member.summary: Determine if the JSONObject contains a specific key.
member.returns: true if the key exists in the JSONObject.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.keys
member.summary: Get an enumeration of the keys of the JSONObject. Added to be true to orginal Java implementation Indexers are easier to use

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.isNull(System.String)
member.summary: Determine if the value associated with the key is null or if there is no value.
member.returns: true if there is no value associated with the key or if the valus is the JSONObject.NULL object

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.Length
member.summary: Get the number of keys stored in the JSONObject.
member.returns: The number of keys in the JSONObject.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.names
member.summary: Produce a JSONArray containing the pks of the elements of this JSONObject
member.returns: A JSONArray containing the key strings, or null if the JSONObject

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.opt(System.String)
member.summary: Get an optional value associated with a key.
member.returns: An object which is the value, or null if there is no value.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.optBoolean(System.String)
member.summary: Get an optional value associated with a key. It returns false if there is no such key, or if the value is not Boolean.TRUE or the String "true".

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.optBoolean(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get an optional value associated with a key. It returns false if there is no such key, or if the value is not Boolean.TRUE or the String "true".
member.param: The preferred return value if conversion fails

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.optDouble(System.String)
member.summary: Get an optional double associated with a key, or NaN if there is no such key or if its value is not a number. If the value is a string, an attempt will be made to evaluate it as a number.
member.param: A string which is the key.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.optDouble(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Get an optional double associated with a key, or NaN if there is no such key or if its value is not a number. If the value is a string, an attempt will be made to evaluate it as a number.
member.param: A string which is the key.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.optInt(System.String)
member.summary: Get an optional double associated with a key, or the defaultValue if there is no such key or if its value is not a number. If the value is a string, an attempt will be made to evaluate it as number.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.optInt(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get an optional double associated with a key, or the defaultValue if there is no such key or if its value is not a number. If the value is a string, an attempt will be made to evaluate it as number.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.optJSONArray(System.String)
member.summary: Get an optional JSONArray associated with a key. It returns null if there is no such key, or if its value is not a JSONArray
member.returns: A JSONArray which is the value

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.optJSONObject(System.String)
member.summary: Get an optional JSONObject associated with a key. It returns null if there is no such key, or if its value is not a JSONObject.
member.returns: A JSONObject which is the value

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.optString(System.String)
member.summary: Get an optional string associated with a key. It returns an empty string if there is no such key. If the value is not a string and is not null, then it is coverted to a string.
member.returns: A string which is the value.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.optString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get an optional string associated with a key. It returns the defaultValue if there is no such key.
member.returns: A string which is the value.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.put(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Put a key/value pair in the JSONObject. If the value is null, then the key will be removed from the JSONObject if it is present.
member.param: An object which is the value. It should be of one of these types: Boolean, Double, Integer, JSONArray, JSONObject, String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.remove(System.String)
member.summary: Remove a object assosiateted with the given key

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.toJSONArray(NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray)
member.summary: Append an array of JSONObjects to current object

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.ToString
member.summary: Overridden to return a JSON formattet object as a string

member.name: P:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the key for the associated index

member.name: P:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Get/Add an object with the associated key

member.name: P:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.Count
member.summary: Return the number of JSON items in hashtable

member.name: T:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONObject.JSONNull
member.summary: Make a Null object JSONObject.NULL is equivalent to the value that JavaScript calls null, whilst C#'s null is equivalent to the value that JavaScript calls undefined.

member.name: T:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray
member.summary:
A JSONArray is an ordered sequence of values. Its external form is a string wrapped in square brackets with commas between the values. The internal form is an object having get() and opt() methods for accessing the values by index, and put() methods for adding or replacing values. The values can be any of these types: Boolean, JSONArray, JSONObject, Number, String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.
The constructor can convert a JSON external form string into an internal form Java object. The toString() method creates an external form string.
A get() method returns a value if one can be found, and throws an exception if one cannot be found. An opt() method returns a default value instead of throwing an exception, and so is useful for obtaining optional values.
The generic get() and opt() methods return an object which you can cast or query for type. There are also typed get() and opt() methods that do typing checking and type coersion for you.
The texts produced by the toString() methods are very strict. The constructors are more forgiving in the texts they will accept.
An extra comma may appear just before the closing bracket.
Strings may be quoted with single quotes.
Strings do not need to be quoted at all if they do not contain leading or trailing spaces, and if they do not contain any of these characters: { } [ ] / \ : ,
Numbers may have the 0- (octal) or 0x- (hex) prefix.
Public Domain 2002 JSON.org @author JSON.org @version 0.1
Ported to C# by Are Bjolseth, teleplan.no TODO: 1. Implement Custom exceptions 2. Add indexer JSONObject[i] = object, and object = JSONObject[i]; 3. Add indexer JSONObject["DEFAULT_KEY"] = object, and object = JSONObject["DEFAULT_KEY"] 4. Add unit testing 5. Add log4net 6. Make get/put methods private, to force use of indexer instead?

member.summary: Get the optional object value associated with an index.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.optBoolean(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the optional boolean value associated with an index.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.optBoolean(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the optional boolean value associated with an index. It returns the defaultValue if there is no value at that index or if it is not a Boolean or the String "true" or "false".

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.optDouble(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the optional double value associated with an index. NaN is returned if the index is not found, or if the value is not a number and cannot be converted to a number.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.optDouble(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Get the optional double value associated with an index. NaN is returned if the index is not found, or if the value is not a number and cannot be converted to a number.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.optInt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the optional int value associated with an index. Zero is returned if the index is not found, or if the value is not a number and cannot be converted to a number.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.optInt(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the optional int value associated with an index. The defaultValue is returned if the index is not found, or if the value is not a number and cannot be converted to a number.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.optJSONArray(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the optional JSONArray associated with an index.
member.returns: A JSONArray value, or null if the index has no value, or if the value is not a JSONArray.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.optJSONObject(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the optional JSONObject associated with an index. Null is returned if the DEFAULT_KEY is not found, or null if the index has no value, or if the value is not a JSONObject.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.optString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the optional string value associated with an index. It returns an empty string if there is no value at that index. If the value is not a string and is not null, then it is coverted to a string.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.optString(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Get the optional string associated with an index. The defaultValue is returned if the DEFAULT_KEY is not found.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.put(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Put or replace a boolean value in the JSONArray.
member.param: The subscript. If the index is greater than the length of the JSONArray, then null elements will be added as necessary to pad it out.

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.toJSONObject(NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray)
member.summary: Produce a JSONObject by combining a JSONArray of pks with the values of this JSONArray.
member.param: A JSONArray containing a list of DEFAULT_KEY strings. These will be paired with the values.
member.returns: A JSONObject, or null if there are no pks or if this JSONArray

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.ToString
member.summary: Make an JSON external form string of this JSONArray. For compactness, no unnecessary whitespace is added.
member.returns: a printable, displayable, transmittable representation of the array.

member.name: P:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Alternate to Java get/put method, by using indexer

member.name: P:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.List
member.summary: Alternativ to Java, getArrayList, by using propery

member.name: P:NBear.Common.JSON.JSONArray.Count
member.summary: Get the length of the JSONArray. Using a propery instead of method

member.summary: Parse a Hashtable and return a JSON formatted string

member.name: M:NBear.Common.JSON.JsonFacade.fromJSON(System.String)
member.summary: Parse JSON formatted string and return a Hashtable
